eu.mapperproject.jmml.util.graph
Class PTGraph<T,E extends Edge<T>>

java.lang.Object
  eu.mapperproject.jmml.util.graph.PTGraph<T,E>

public class PTGraph<T,E extends Edge<T>>
extends java.lang.Object

An internal graph. It is convertible from and to a JUNG graph and from a tree.

Author:
Joris Borgdorff

Constructor Summary

          Create a PTGraph, with given (in)directionality.

          Create a PTGraph as a copy of given JUNG Graph.

               java.util.Collection<T> nodes,

Create a PTGraph with given (in)directionality and starting with a collection of nodes and edges.

PTGraph

public PTGraph(edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.Graph<T,E> graph,
               T source,
               T sink)
Create a PTGraph as a copy of given JUNG Graph. If any of the edges have null as from or to node, it will be replaced with given source or sink nodes respectively.

Method Detail

graphFromTree

public static <T extends Child<T>> PTGraph<T,Edge<T>> graphFromTree(Tree<T> tree)
Create a PTGraph from a tree. The created PTGraph will be directed from parents to children.

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if given tree is null

isDirected

public boolean isDirected()
Whether the PTGraph is a directed graph.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Whether the PTGraph contains edges or nodes.

Number of nodes the graph contains.

addEdge

public void addEdge(E e)
Add an edge to the graph.

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if e is null, or its from or to nodes are null.

addNode

public void addNode(T n)
Add a node to the graph.

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if n is null.

getJungGraph

public edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.Graph<T,Edge<T>> getJungGraph(T source,
                                                            T sink)
Create a JUNG graph out of the current PTGraph. Any edges with a from or to node being null, will have those nodes replaced by given source and sink nodes respectively.

partition

public static <T,E extends Edge<T>> Tree<Cluster<T,E>> partition(PTGraph<T,E> graph,
                                                                 Categorizer<T> categorizer)
Partition a graph into clusters based on the category of the graph elements

Parameters:
graph - graph to partition
categorizer - assigns a category to each of the elements of the graph
Returns:
a tree of subgraphs, from upper level category to lower level category
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the graph or any of its elements is null or the categorizer is null
